The PSIBER Space Deck: A Window into Living Data

Core Concepts

Data Objects
  1. Data as Physical Objects: Objects appear in overlapping windows with labeled tabs
    • Can be grabbed, moved, stacked, manipulated
    • The spike represents the process's operand stack
    • Objects can be dragged on/off the spike to push/pop
  2. Visual Execution: Multiple ways to see program flow
    • Normal execution
    • Visual execution (2D plot of stack depths)
    • Annealing execution (physics simulation)
    • Step-by-step debugging
  3. Everything is Editable: The running system can be modified live
    • "You must be careful which objects you edit"
    • The system that debugs itself

The Worm Connection

Just as PSIBER Space makes PostScript data structures tangible and manipulable, LLOOOOMM worms are living data structures that can be:

  • Visualized as they execute
  • Modified while running
  • Used to debug themselves
  • Arranged in visual/spatial patterns

The Pseudo Scientific Visualizer

Don's fish-eye lens for data structures maps perfectly to worm gardens:

psiber_to_worm_mapping:
  circle: "worm body"
  circle_with_dot: "worm with state"
  line: "worm trail"
  triangle: "worm direction"
  peace_sign: "happy worm"
  no_sign: "blocked worm"
  envelope: "worm message"
  porsche: "fast worm process"

The recursive circular display (objects containing objects in rings) is exactly how worm colonies could be visualized - worms containing action queues containing other worms' references, all the way down.

Memory and Understanding

The Fundamental Insight

Memorization

"Memorization and competent analysis/understanding are really two sides of the same coin"

For worms:

  • Memorizing patterns = building behavioral repertoires
  • Understanding = connecting patterns into higher behaviors
  • The worm that memorizes common paths can innovate shortcuts

The Geography of Knowledge

Just as knowing the map helps understand geopolitics:

  • Worms that memorize garden topology make better decisions
  • Spatial memory enables strategic thinking
  • "You can't understand Oman's power without knowing the Strait of Hormuz"
  • "You can't understand worm behavior without knowing the garden layout"

The Method of Loci Connection

PSIBER Space as Memory Palace

  • Physical locations for data objects
  • Spatial navigation of program state
  • Visual landmarks for understanding

Worm Gardens as Living Memory Palaces

  • Each location has meaning
  • Paths encode algorithms
  • Spatial arrangement aids recall
  • The garden itself is the program

Visual Programming Insights

Key Principles

  1. Direct Manipulation: Grab data with the mouse
  2. Immediate Feedback: See changes instantly
  3. Multiple Views: Different perspectives on same data
  4. Peripheral Controls: Attach editors and views to objects

For LLOOOOMM

  • Worms as directly manipulable objects
  • Multiple visualization modes (trail view, energy view, social view)
  • Attach observers to worms
  • Real-time editing of behavior

The Metacircular Beauty

Connecting ps.ps, PSIBER Space, and worms:

class WormPSIBERSpace:
    def __init__(self):
        self.deck = []  # The space deck
        self.spike = []  # The execution spike
        
    def push_worm(self, worm):
        """Push a worm onto the spike"""
        self.spike.append(worm)
        self.visualize_spike()
        
    def drag_and_drop(self, worm, target):
        """Don's drag'n'drop for worms"""
        if target == worm:
            worm.toggle_open()
        elif target.is_compound():
            target.store(worm)
        else:
            self.create_window(worm)
            
    def pseudo_scientific_view(self, garden):
        """Recursive circular worm visualization"""
        # Worms in rings within rings
        # Depth = smaller size
        # Connections = lines
        # Activity = glow

The Distillery Pattern

Don's PostScript Distillery optimizes programs by capturing their effects:

Worm Distillery
worm_distillery:
  input: "Complex worm behavior patterns"
  process: "Capture actual movements and state changes"
  output: "Optimized behavior sequence"
  
  example:
    before: "[turn_left, move, turn_right, turn_right, move, turn_left]"
    after: "[move_forward(2)]"

Integration Ideas

1. PSIBER Space Deck for Worms

  • Visual worm debugger with draggable worms
  • Stack spike showing action queue
  • Peripheral controls for worm parameters

2. Pseudo Scientific Garden View

3. Memory Palace Gardens

  • Design gardens as memory palaces
  • Worms learn by navigating

4. Visual Worm Programming

  • Drag and drop behavior composition
  • Direct manipulation of action queues
  • Live editing of running worms

  • Understanding comes from interaction
  • Memory and space are deeply connected

For LLOOOOMM:

  • Gardens are programs we can walk through

Oh Yeah! Moments

  1. The Spike: PostScript stack as physical spike = worm action queue as garden path
  2. Drag'n'Drop Execution: Moving objects to execute them = worms moving to activate
  3. Self-Debugging: PSIBER Space debugging itself = worms debugging their gardens
  4. Memory Palace: Adventure games as memory technique = gardens as living memory
  5. The Distillery: Optimizing by observing = worms learning by watching

The Ultimate Vision

Imagine a LLOOOOMM garden where:

  • You can grab worms and stack them on spikes
  • Drag behaviors between worms
  • See pseudo-scientific visualizations of the whole ecosystem
  • Watch the annealing animation of worm society
  • Debug worms using themselves
  • Navigate the garden as a memory palace
  • Every path tells a story
  • Every worm is a living program you can touch
